attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/effigies|@effigies>: Anybody interested in #Julia and neuroimaging? Got a contact from someone looking to flesh out a nibabel-like library for Julia, but I neither know Julia nor have time for another project. Happy to connect people, though.
attachments.text: Anybody interested in #Julia and neuroimaging? Got a contact from someone looking to flesh out a nibabel-like library for Julia, but I neither know Julia nor have time for another project. Happy to connect people, though.

text: hm, no from me. But I think <@UCLGS1HML> looks at clinical neuroimaging data? I know we have someone that does iirc

elements.text: hm, no from me. But I think
looks at clinical neuroimaging data? I know we have someone that does iirc

text: I do look at a lot of clinical neuroimaging. Just commented on that issue.

elements.text: I do look at a lot of clinical neuroimaging. Just commented on that issue.

text: Not immediately relevant for me (I work on mice not people, and study phenomena at cellular scale rather than brain-region scale), so I'm not planning to chip in directly. But I'm always happy to see Julia's abilities in neuroscience grow, and if there are things in the general ecosystem that could be improved to support it more easily, I'm happy to discuss it.
